Name: Injected
Description: Injection via Syringe. Cannot be done to an aware enemy with a normal syringe unless it is restrained, paralized ,stunned , incapacitated or unconscious.

Name: Tipped
Description: Applied to projectile munitions/small instruments that deal piercing or slashing damage. Takes 1 Action to properly apply and lasts for 1 hour or until the munition is used.

Name: Coated
Description: Applied to melee weapons that deal piercing or slashing damage. Takes 1 Action to properly apply and lasts for 1 hour or until the weapon is used.

Name: Absorbed
Description: Must be applied on a body cavity (eyes, mouth, nose, etc.). Takes 30 minutes to begin its work.

Name: Ingested
Description: Must be fed to the target. Takes 1 minute to begin its work.

Name: Touched
Description: Must be applied against the skin. Takes 1 hour to begin its work. Will continue applying until it is wiped.

Name: Gas
Description: Must be evaporated into the air. The gas expands into the room (at 15ft per round, resolving at the end of the round) or dissipates. Gas is heavier than air unless specified. 1 dose requires 10 GP worth of gunpowder or another method of evaporation.

Name: Smoke
Description: Must be ignited. The smoke will expand into the room (at 30ft per round, resolving at the end of the round) or dissipate. Smoke is lighter than air unless specified. 1 dose requires 10 GP worth of gunpowder or another quick ignition method.
